item.title: Hades 2: All Animal Companions (& How to Unlock, Upgrade, and Use Them)
item.description:
As you make your way beyond the underworld in Hades 2 , there are various components in the game that can help you. These include different weapons, items, and even familiars. Each will be necessary if you wish to survive your adventure and defeat the Titan of Time.

When it comes to familiars, you will get a couple of different choices. Both can help you, but in different ways. Where one may deal more damage, the other helps to restore your health more. The choice is ultimately yours, and it will obviously depend on your playstyle.

Unlocking Familiars in Hades 2

To unlock familiars, Melinoë must cast an Incantation at the Cauldron in the Crossroads. You will need the Faith of Familiar Spirits incantation , which won't be unlocked until halfway through the game, or further. It may take a few hours of gameplay to unlock it, but once you do, it is a game changer. Out of all the incantations in Hades 2 , you can actually get many of them from the Headmistress Hecate after you defeat her. Keep in mind that you may have to defeat her a few times before she suggests you bring a Familiar for your next fight. This is when she will teach you the Faith of Familiar Spirits Incantation.

To cast this incantation, you need 2x Nectar and 1x Lotus Flower . To find Nectar, look for rooms that have the Nectar symbol on them, or just purchase it for 50 bones from the Wretched Broker. You can collect Lotus Flowers in Oceanus.

When you cast the Faith of Familiar Spirits, you will receive 1 Witch's Delight. Simply gift this to an animal of your liking to make them a Familiar. In Hades 2, you will have two options when it comes to Familiars.

Frinos the Frog

Frinos can be found near Melinoe's tent. Not only can he boost your life, but he can also be used as a defensive mechanism, as he blocks projectiles. He can also deal damage to your enemies. He can use the Life Bond and Soul Bond abilities while the two of you are together.

Bond Type

Rank 1

Rank 2

Rank 3

Soul Bond

+1 Tool Support to use every night

+2 Tool Support

+3 Tool Support

Strength Bond

+10 damage when he leaps into enemies

+20 damage when he leaps into enemies

+30 damage when he leaps into enemies

Life Bond

+10 Max Life

+20 Max Life

+30 Max Life

Toula the Cat

After you cast the Woodsy Lifespring Incantation, you will encounter Toula in Erebus. Unlike Frinos, Toula does not stay in one place too long. This makes her difficult to find sometimes, especially if you want to make her your Familiar. Ensure you have some fast weapons to defeat enemies with if you wish to fly through an area trying to find her quickly. After you defeat Polyphemus in Ephyra, you may find her on the Pier. Being a cat, however, you can expect her to be a bit independent.

Bond Type

Rank 1

Rank 2

Rank 3

Claw Bond

+1 strike until she loses interest

+2 strikes until she loses interest

+3 strikes until she loses interest

Heart Bond

Death Defiance effects: restore +10 health

Death Defiance effects: restore +20 health

Death Defiance effects: restore +30 health

Soul Bond

+1 Fishing Rod use every night

+2 Fishing Rod use every night

+3 Fishing Rod use every night

Upgrading Familiars in Hades 2

To reach each rank in your Familiar's abilities, you will have to craft more Witch's Delights. Once you craft them, give them to your Familiar as a gift. Use the Beast-Loved Morsel Alchemy recipe at a Cauldron to create more Witch's Delights.

This recipe can be used once you cast the Faith of Familiar Spirits incantation. The ingredient that may be a little difficult to find is the Star Dust. To get it, cast Abyssal Night Incantation, which you can get from Chaos, are at the Crossroads near the Pitch-Block Stone.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2: All Gang Members’ Deaths, Ranked
item.description:
Red Dead Redemption 2 largely centers around the characters of the Van Der Linde gang, and explains their story leading up to the events of the first game. As the missions progress, players will become intimately acquainted with all members of the gang, who share a camp and can be interacted with in a variety of ways. The excellent writing and characterization of each gang member makes them all unique and memorable.

Unfortunately, things don't work out for everyone, and by the time the story is fully completed across both games, the vast majority of the Van Der Linde gang end up dead. Whether in dramatic, bullet-strewn last stands or peacefully on mountainsides looking at the sunrise, each member meets their end in a different way, further reflecting the violence and cheapness of life during the old west time period.

19 Kieran Duffy

A Disproportionately Gruesome Fate For The Harmless Horse Whisperer

From the first minute, Arthur and the gang meet Kieran Duffy, he is already in a pretty unfortunate position. As a low-level hired gun for the O'Driscoll Boys, he is quickly captured by the Van Der Linde gang and tied to a post, interrogated, and threatened with castration.

Over time, Kieran proves himself to be trustworthy, and even teaches players the art of fishing. Sadly for Kieran, his small amount of luck finally runs dry in Chapter Four, when he is beheaded and has his eyes gouged out by the O'Driscolls before being sent back as a message.

18 Sean McGuire

An Unceremonious End For A Good Irish Ally

Like most of the Van Der Linde gang, Sean McGuire is a slightly immoral, slightly untrustworthy and entirely mad gunslinger with kleptomaniacal tendencies. In many ways, Sean is almost like a younger brother figure to Arthur, who even says as much at the end of the mission "The Fine Joys of Tobacco".

What makes Sean's death so bad is how unexpected and un-heroic it is. Out of nowhere, while walking through Rhodes, Sean is sniped through the head by a rooftop shooter and falls dead, mid-conversation.

17 Lenny Summers

An Underwhelming Finish For A Bright And Promising Character

16

Lenny is another character who meets his demise quite unexpectedly, and many players will hold a fondness for him after the drunken escapades of the mission "A Quiet Time". A bright and curious chap, Lenny spends most of his time reading, and further digging into his backstory will reveal that he had quite a harsh upbringing.

Lenny's death is certainly underwhelming, and lacks the drama that perhaps he deserved. After robbing the bank in Saint Denis, Lenny is killed while fleeing over the rooftops by pursuing Pinkertons. Unfortunately, there is no way to stop it from happening.

15 Hosea Matthews

The Old Veteran's Ambition Leads To His Own Undoing

14

Old Hosea Matthews is something of a father figure to most members in the gang. Often advising and planning big scores, Hosea is known for his wit and charm, as well as his love for the theatrical and the dramatic.

Ultimately, there is an element of poetic justice to Hosea's death, since he originally planned the Saint Denis bank robbery to begin with. When it all goes wrong, Hosea is captured and executed by the vile Agent Milton, in plain view of his "family", the gang.

13 Bill Williamson

Bill's Valiant Escape Efforts Are Cut Short At The Final Hurdle

12

While Bill Williamson is one of the more pitiful members of the Van Der Linde gang. Though he is often workshy around camp and more commonly found in a drunken stupor, his unwavering loyalty to the gang is certainly admirable.

Bill miraculously manages to survive the events of Red Dead Redemption 2 and escapes to Mexico with Javier. His ultimate fate is sealed in the first game, when John Marston is tasked with tracking him down and finishing him off. So close, yet so far.

11 Uncle

The Old Comedian Is Loyal To The Very End

10

Uncle is another character who, quite miraculously, survives far longer than he should. The lumbago-ridden lazy bones is best known for his sense of humour, and for contributing as little as possible in the way of work to the gang.

Things change, however, in the events of the original Red Dead Redemption. Having lived a long and unstrenuous life, Uncle makes an epic stand in an attempt to hold off Pinkertons who are invading Beecher's Hope. Fighting side by side with Jack and John Marston, Uncle is shot in the heart and finally falls to rest against the wood of the ranch he helped to build.

9 Javier Escuella

The Mexican's Wish Of Dying On Home Turf Is Eventually Fulfilled

8

Javier Escuella is a cunning and loyal member of the Van Der Linde gang. Javier is certainly smarter than Bill and Uncle, so his survival of the events in Red Dead Redemption 2 comes as less of a surprise.

Although he is ultimately executed in the sand at the hands of John Marston, Javier did manage to fulfill his wish of returning to his home country of Mexico and dying there. While perhaps not as peaceful as he might have envisioned, Javier's death is certainly better than many others in the gang.

7 Dutch Van Der Linde

Giving No One Else The Satisfaction, Dutch Takes His Own Life

6

While Dutch's death does come until the very end of Red Dead Redemption , following the events of Red Dead Redemption 2 , there is again an element of poetic justice to it. Having spent his entire life on the run, he finally runs out of track when confronted on a cliff-edge by John Marston.

After giving yet another one of his self-important speeches in the style of a Roman statesman, Dutch then plummets to his death in act of suicide, which seems appropriate for a man entirely obsessed with controlling his own fate.

5 Micah Bell

The Treacherous Villain Goes Down In A Blaze Of Mountain-High Glory

4

Though Micah Bell is arguably the most loathsome and evil character Rockstar have ever created, he certainly doesn't go down without a fight. A desperate man by all accounts, Micah flees to Mount Hagen and fortifies himself in a small camp there.

When John finally tracks him down in the epilogue of Red Dead Redemption 2 , Micah truly earns his status as a legendary outlaw. In a one on one duel, Micah is bested by John, and simply shruggs at the defeat before collapsing, face first, into the snow.

3 Arthur Morgan

Whether Good Or Evil, Arthur Ultimately Gets Whatever He Deserves

2

As the main protagonist of Red Dead Redemption 2 , Arthur Morgan's death is perhaps the saddest in the entire series. While there are several ways in which he can die, depending on the player's choices, each one is suitably appropriate for him.

In high honor endings, Arthur will meet a much more peaceful end, staring into the sunset as the breath slowly leaves his lungs for good. The more violent low honor ending, in which he is shot in the head by Micah, is equally deserved if players have chosen to make him evil.

1 John Marston

A Fighter To The Very End, John's Death Is The Stuff Of Legend

John Marston features heavily in Red Dead Redemption 2, and is the main protagonist of the original Red Dead Redemption . While is not as charismatic as Arthur, he can be considered a relatively noble and well-meaning man, placing the security of his family above all else.

Having done everything in his power to free his wife and son from the grip of the Pinkertons, John is ultimately betrayed by them, leading to the last stand at Beecher's Hope. In a tribute to the legendary film Butch Cassidy And The Sundance Kid , John exits the barn faced with an impossible number of enemies pointing their gun at him. While his death may be inevitable in this scenario, he faces it with the courage of a legendary Wild West outlaw.

item.title: 6 Best Third-Person Shooters On The Wii, Ranked
item.description:
Nintendo's Wii was a pretty appealing system for developers who were working on third-person shooter games at the time. On the one hand, the Wii wasn't as obsessed with realistic graphics as the Xbox 360 or the PS3, which meant these games could have fairly unique art styles and visual aesthetics to set them apart. Of course, there was also the motion controls, which were seen as groundbreaking for the time, especially for shooter games where they could add an extra layer of immersion to the experience.

Needless to say, there were plenty of fun and memorable third-person shooter games for this beloved system, and while not all of them made much of an impression, there's still a handful which have been met with much more praise, and are well worth checking out for any fans of the genre. Here are the very best third-person shooter games that arrived on the Wii throughout its lengthy life span. Before jumping in, it should be noted that games which could be considered on-rails in their movement, but which still take a third person camera angle, will be eligible and considered for the list.

6 Chicken Little: Ace In Action

No Score Available

  • Release Date: December 2006
  • Platforms: Wii, PlayStation 2, DS, PC
  • Developer: Avalanche Software

Rather than controlling the titular character seen in the movie, Chicken Little: Ace in Action sees players fill the shoes of Ace, a big and bulky version of Chicken Little who comes equipped with his own mini-arsenal of weapons. Though the game plays like a traditional third-person shooter, what makes it so much fun is how varied the levels are in terms of gimmicks.

One moment, Ace will hop into a tank to decimate any robotic enemies who stand in his way, while the next, he'll be flying around space blasting ships and asteroids to pieces as he goes. Each mission feels drastically different from the one that came before it, and with 24 of them to play through, it results in a fun thrillride which doesn't take itself too seriously and is a blast to play through.

5 Bionicle Heroes

Metacritic User Score: 6.0

  • Release Date: April 2007
  • Platforms: Wii, Xbox 360, DS, PlayStation 2, GameCube, PC
  • Developer: Traveller's Tales

Each mission in Bionicle Heroes contains several Toa Masks players can pick up by doing a little exploring. These unique items allow players to change characters on the fly, and since each of these Bionicles have their own weapons, it provides a fresh and fun spin on the regular third-person shooter formula. It also allows the game to get creative with the level design, since players will need to use specific mask powers to access specific areas, almost like using a HM move in the Pokemon games.

Bionicle Heroes also features a hub area known as the Matoran Enclave where players can purchase new upgrades, providing a satisfying progression system which makes exploration for extra resources well worth it. The game is admittedly on the shorter side clocking in at roughly 5 to 6 hours long, but there's still a ton of fun to be had here.

4 Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon

Metacritic User Score: 6.6

  • Release Date: November 2010
  • Platform: Wii
  • Developer: Next Level Games

Most shooter games on the Wii take a fast-paced run-and-gun approach to their gameplay, but Ghost Recon is a lot slower and more tactical, and as a result, it's also a lot harder to beat. The game also has quite a peculiar movement system, since it doesn't technically allow players to move around in the open. Instead, they will need to bounce between cover and be cautious about when to pop their head out from cover to take a few pot-shots at nearby enemies.

There's a nice mixture of mission types here that helps the game from ever becoming stale or predictable, with the stealth missions being a particular highlight because of how intense they can be. Missing a single shot, or firing at the wrong body part, can result in a game overscreen pretty quickly, so a lot of patience is required when taking on these missions. There's also co-op functionality, which works surprisingly well, and makes the game quite a bit easier as a result.

3 Rogue Trooper: Quartz Zone Massacre

No Score Available

  • Release Date: December 2009
  • Platforms: Wii, Xbox, PlayStation 2, Switch, PlayStation 4
  • Developer: Rebellion Developments

Based on a planet called Nu-Earth which is in the middle of a raging conflict between the Norts and Southers, Rogue Trooper: Quartz Zone Massacre is an action-packed experience which is full of epic battles and firefights to take part of. Though the protagonist, Rogue, only starts off with a bulky assault rifle and a handgun, players will be able to acquire extra weapons and attachments as they progress through the story. This allows Rogue to get his hands on some utterly devastating guns, one such example being the electric beam rifle which can decimate an enemy with a single shot.

While Rogue is able to fire off his weapons while behind cover, or while on the run, there's also an option to lay down covering fire which can be used to separate enemies into smaller groups, making them easier to pick off. Rogue Trooper: Quartz Zone Massacre also has a great story which contains a few twists and turns, and actually provides a fairly harrowing insight into the mindset of soldiers during wartime, and how expendable they can feel when throwing themselves into the line of fire.

2 Sin & Punishment: Star Successor

Metacritic User Score: 8.4

  • Release Date: June 2010
  • Platform: Wii
  • Developer: Treasure

Though Sin & Punishment: Star Successor is technically an on-rails game, it does still play like a third-person shooter and allows players to freely move around the screen while they fire away at the myriad of monsters they'll encounter along their journey. However, protagonists Isa and Kachi also possess a blade which can be used to deflect projectiles, encouraging players to switch between weapons on the fly to rack up as much damage as possible.

The game also stands out for its bright and vibrant visual style, which allows the beautiful environments to pop out from the screen. There's even a combo multiplier in the top right of the screen which can net players bonus score if they manage to keep a combo going without taking a hit in the process. Overall, an incredibly fun game which both looks and feels amazing.

1 Resident Evil 4

Metacritic User Score: 9.1

Capcom's decision to introduce a third-person camera angle for Resident Evil 4 was a risky one, but it was a choice that ultimately paid off, and paved the way for many other survival horror games going forward. Being able to follow Leon's journey from an over the shoulder perspective helps to make the gameplay feel more intimate and intense, especially considering how ruthless the Ganado enemies are.

Speaking of the Ganado, players are able to aim their crosshair with the Wii's motion controls to inflict damage on specific body parts of their targets. So if an enemy was shot in the leg, they would hold onto their knee in pain, giving Leon an opportunity to pull off a roundhouse kick while they're stunned. The motion controls are also responsive and extremely fun to use, to the point where many consider this the best version of this survival horror classic due to how immersive it is, thanks to the Wii's flagship gimmick.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for June 16, 2024
item.description:
Strands is back with another challenging daily puzzle. If you like word searches but wish they were a little more difficult, this challenging puzzle game is for you. But for some, this game might end up being a little too challenging.

If you already know the rules of how to play Strands and are stuck on today's puzzle, you can find all the help you need below. In this article are helpful hints like general clues to get you closer to the theme, individual word spoilers, and even the full answer if you would like to see that.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #105 for June 16, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue It's in the Bag . There are seven total items to find: one Spangram category and six themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you don't like the in-game spoiler system that Strands provides, but you still need some help, you can get some clues below for this relaxing puzzle game. Each of the three sections below has a general clue hidden inside.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

If you want to see the full answer to the New York Times Games Strands , you can find it in the section below. The section contains all the words and the Spangram along with their positions in the puzzle.

Today's Strands Explained

Don't get it? Inside the section below is a full explanation of how the Spangram, the clue, and the theme all fit together in this puzzle game.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Blox Fruits: How To Level Up Fast
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Level Up Fast In Blox Fruits
  • Choose The Right Area For Leveling Up In Blox Fruits

In order to access high-level content in Blox Fruits and participate in different dangerous activities, you will need to level up your character. So, you may want to know how to do it faster and more effectively. This guide will provide you with some tips that will help you to level up fast in Roblox 's Blox Fruits .

How To Level Up Fast In Blox Fruits

There are plenty of ways to get some EXP in Blox Fruits , but not all of them are that effective. The following sections will give you some tips on what you should do to progress faster. With this information, you should be able to speed up your progress significantly and quickly reach higher levels.

Complete Quests In Blox Fruits

Quests are particular tasks that you can receive from different NPCs. There are a lot of them, and they provide you with tons of EXP. So, complete quests whenever possible, and you will quickly progress in this game. Additionally, completing these tasks will reward you with various valuable items.

Farm Mobs In Blox Fruits

Another way to get a lot of EXP is to simply grind mobs. However, in order to do this effectively, you will need to use an effective strategy. The Buddha fruit or Elemental fruits can be quite helpful for grinding. Also, definitely use melee fighting styles or swords to accelerate the farming process. If you have a good strategy for grinding mobs, you will be able to get a decent amount of EXP.

Defeat Bosses In Blox Fruits

Defeating bosses is another excellent way to level up fast. There are many of them, and if you defeat a boss who matches your level , you will get many EXP points. However, be careful, as some of these enemies can be problematic to deal with.

Purchase EXP Boosters In Blox Fruits

You can buy EXP Boosters with your Robux. These things increase the amount of EXP you receive and can significantly speed up the leveling process. Also, you can get them by redeeming codes. So, when you want to grind some EXP, consider purchasing an EXP Booster .

Play As Human Or Ghoul In Blox Fruits

We recommend using the Human race as it provides you with good bonuses and is easy to obtain. However, Ghoul can be more helpful in grinding due to its lifesteal and overall survivability. So, if you can unlock this race, you should definitely use it.

Choose The Right Area For Leveling Up In Blox Fruits

To level up faster, you will need to go to an area that has content for your level. Here is a list of islands and their recommended levels:

Islands Of The First Sea

  • Starter Pirate/Maribe Island – Levels 0-10
  • Jungle – Levels 10-30
  • Pirate Village – Levels 30-60
  • Desert – Levels 60-90
  • Frozen Village – Levels 90-120
  • Middle Town – Level 100
  • Marine Fortress – Levels 120-150
  • Lower Skylands – Levels 150-190
  • Prison – Levels 190-250
  • Colosseum – Levels 250-300
  • Magma Village – Levels 300-375
  • Underwater City – Levels 375-450
  • Upper Skylands – Levels 450-625
  • Fountain City – Levels 625-700

Islands Of The Second Sea

  • Usoap’s Island or Remote Island – Level 700+
  • Kingdom of Rose – Levels 700-850
  • Green Zone – Levels 875-950
  • Graveyard – Levels 950-1000
  • Dark Arena – Level 1000
  • Snow Mountain – Levels 1000-1100
  • Hot and Cold – Levels 1100-1250
  • Cursed Ship – Levels 1250-1350
  • Ice Castle – Levels 1350-1425
  • Forgotten Island – Levels 1425-1500

Islands Of The Third Sea

  • Port Town – Levels 1500-1575
  • Hydra Island – Levels 1575-1700
  • Great Tree – Levels 1700-1775
  • Floating Turtle – Levels 1775-1975
  • Haunted Castle – Levels 1975-2075
  • Sea of Treats – Levels 2075-2450
  • Tiki Outpost – Level 2450+

That’s all you need to know to level up fast in Blox Fruits . Hopefully, this information will help you on this uneasy journey.
